content:
Based on the execution logs and entity data, here's the updated report:

EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Production Line
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-15.0, -50.0) connected to wooden chest at (-14.5, -48.5) for iron ore collection
- Four stone furnaces for smelting iron plates:
  - Furnace at (0.0, 0.0)
  - Furnace at (2.0, 0.0)
  - Furnace at (4.0, 4.0)
  - Furnace at (6.0, 4.0)

### Iron Gear Wheel Assembly Line
Consists of:
- Input wooden chest at (21.5, 4.5)
- Burner inserter at (22.5, 4.5) moving items from input chest to assembler
- Assembling machine at (24.5, 4.5) crafting iron gear wheels
- Burner inserter at (26.5, 4.5) moving products to output chest
- Output wooden chest at (27.5, 4.5) storing finished gear wheels
- Small electric pole at (22.5, 6.5) powering the assembler

### Power Generation System
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5) extracting water
- Pipe network connecting pump to boiler
- Boiler at (-2.0, 23.5) heating water into steam
- Steam engine at (9.5, 19.5) generating electricity
- Small electric pole at (9.5, 17.5) connected to steam engine
- Extensive electricity pole network connecting power to machines

### Research Facility
- Lab (position not specified) connected to power grid

ERROR TIPS

### Resource Management Errors
- Ensure sufficient coal is available in inventory before attempting to insert fuel into machines
- Monitor fuel levels in burner devices (mining drills, inserters, boilers) to prevent work stoppages

### Production Line Issues
- Assembler showing ingredient shortage - ensure consistent supply of iron plates to input chest
- Boiler frequently running out of fuel - implement better fuel management system

### Power Distribution
- Lab showing no power status - verify all electrical connections are properly made and maintained
- Ensure power poles are properly connected to form a complete electrical network

### Machine Status Monitoring
- Multiple furnaces showing "no ingredients to smelt" - implement better resource distribution
- Monitor and maintain fuel levels in all burner-type machines to prevent production stops
